decks.notes: This deck aims to quickly reduce the opponent's life total by casting a series of direct damage spells and attacking with aggressive creatures. The key strategy involves utilizing cheap burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Spike, as well as efficient creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Goblin Guide to apply continuous pressure. Price of Progress and Sulfuric Vortex help deal additional damage while disrupting the opponent's mana base. Overall, the deck focuses on fast, aggressive gameplay to win the game before the opponent can stabilize.

This Legacy 1 vs 1 Control deck focuses on using a combination of counterspells, removal, and card advantage to control the game. It utilizes a variety of efficient spells like Force of Will, Fatal Push, and Thoughtseize to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating value with cards like Snapcaster Mage and Baleful Strix. The deck also includes threats like Tarmogoyf and Jace, the Mind Sculptor to apply pressure and close out the game. Overall, the goal is to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent to secure victory.

This deck focuses on disrupting opponents' strategies while applying pressure with efficient creatures and equipment. By utilizing cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Rishadan Port to slow down opponents, combined with disruptive creatures like Judge's Familiar and Phyrexian Revoker, it aims to control the game tempo. Meanwhile, efficient threats like Mirran Crusader and Stoneforge Mystic equipped with powerful equipment like Batterskull and Sword of Fire and Ice help close out games quickly. The deck also utilizes Aether Vial for mana acceleration and instant speed creature deployment.

The main concept of the deck is to utilize a variety of control tools such as counterspells, removal, and card draw to keep the opponent on the back foot while establishing a strong board presence. The deck also includes powerful threats like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and True-Name Nemesis, along with efficient mana accelerants like Noble Hierarch and Deathrite Shaman. The inclusion of key equipment like Batterskull, Sword of Fire and Ice, and Umezawa's Jitte allows for additional value and versatility in combat. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's diverse color requirements and provide disruption through Wasteland.

The deck focuses on using Cloudpost and Glimmerpost to quickly ramp into powerful Eldrazi threats like Ulamog, Kozilek, and Emrakul. Trinisphere and Thorn of Amethyst help disrupt opponents' strategies, while Sorcerous Spyglass provides information and disruption. Ugin, the Spirit Dragon acts as a versatile board wipe and finisher, and All Is Dust can clear the opponent's board. With strong mana acceleration from Ancient Tomb and Eldrazi Temple, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with powerful threats and disrupt their game plan with disruptive spells like Chalice of the Void and Thought-Knot Seer.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan through taxing effects like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and wasteland while also applying pressure with efficient creatures like Stoneforge Mystic and Mirran Crusader. By utilizing Aether Vial, the deck is able to deploy threats at instant speed and generate incremental advantage. With access to powerful equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Sword of Fire and Ice, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent in the long game. The inclusion of Karakas and Flickerwisp provides additional utility and disruption, allowing for versatile plays and keeping the opponent off balance.

The main concept of this Merfolk aggro deck is to quickly establish a board presence with efficient creatures like True-Name Nemesis and Master of the Pearl Trident, supported by Lord of Atlantis to pump them up. By using cards like Aether Vial and Mutavault, the deck aims to deploy threats rapidly and overwhelm the opponent. Chalice of the Void and Force of Will provide disruption against the opponent's strategies, while Vendilion Clique offers additional disruption and card selection. The deck is focused on aggressive tempo plays and leveraging the tribal synergy of Merfolk creatures.

This deck focuses on quickly generating mana and card advantage to assemble the necessary pieces for a powerful combo finish. By using rituals and cantrips to generate mana and dig through the deck, the deck is able to quickly find key combo pieces like Lion's Eye Diamond, Infernal Tutor, and Tendrils of Agony. The deck also utilizes disruptive spells like Duress and Cabal Therapy to disrupt opponents' game plans and protect its own combo. Overall, the deck aims to storm off and win the game in a single explosive turn.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through various counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage engines like Search for Azcanta and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. It utilizes cards like Counterbalance to disrupt opponents' spells, along with multiple cantrips like Brainstorm and Ponder to dig for answers. The win conditions include Terminus to control the board, Entreat the Angels for a fast clock, and Snapcaster Mage to replay key spells. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent through efficient removal and powerful card draw options.

The main concept of this Legacy combo deck is to generate a large amount of mana quickly through rituals and mana rocks, then use card draw and search spells to find and assemble the storm combo pieces - specifically Ad Nauseam and Tendrils of Agony - to win the game in a single turn. The deck contains multiple ways to disrupt the opponent's hand and game plan, while also having the flexibility to search for specific cards with Burning Wish. Overall, the strategy revolves around timing and sequencing the spells correctly to create a lethal storm count.

The main concept of this deck is to generate a large amount of mana quickly, allowing the player to cast a series of spells in order to create a storm count and then finish the game with a lethal Tendrils of Agony. The deck also includes cards that provide card advantage and disruption, such as Duress and Cabal Therapy, to help the player navigate through their opponent's defenses. The goal is to assemble the necessary pieces to execute the combo efficiently while protecting it from disruption.

The deck focuses on aggressive plays with cheap and efficient spells like Lightning Bolt and Daze, along with disruptive elements like Wasteland and Force of Will to disrupt the opponent's plans. The deck aims to pressure the opponent with early threats like Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, and True-Name Nemesis while generating advantage with cards like Brainstorm and Gitaxian Probe. The deck also utilizes Deathrite Shaman for additional mana acceleration and graveyard disruption. The overall strategy is to apply consistent pressure while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through a variety of spells and creatures, using cards like Force of Will, Brainstorm, and Snapcaster Mage to disrupt your opponent's strategy while building card advantage. The deck also utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Liliana of the Veil to further control the board. With a mix of removal spells, card draw, and versatile threats, this control archetype aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent to secure victory in the Legacy format.

The main concept of this Eldrazi Aggro deck is to ramp up quickly using lands like Glimmerpost, Eye of Ugin, and Eldrazi Temple to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures such as Thought-Knot Seer, Reality Smasher, and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. The deck also utilizes disruptive cards like Chalice of the Void and Sorcerous Spyglass to control the opponent's game plan. By combining fast mana acceleration with big threats, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and close out the game quickly with powerful Eldrazi creatures.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent with counterspells and land destruction while applying pressure with efficient creatures and burn spells. Utilizing versatile cards like Daze and Force of Will, alongside disrupting a opponent's mana base with Wasteland, the deck aims to keep the opponent on the back foot while quickly closing out the game with threats like Delver of Secrets, True-Name Nemesis, and Young Pyromancer. The deck aims to maintain tempo and pressure throughout the game, while also having ways to interact with the opponent's game plan through disruption and removal spells.

The deck focuses on using the card Show and Tell to cheat in powerful creatures such as Griselbrand and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn early in the game. With the help of ramp cards like Lotus Petal and Ancient Tomb, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with these giant threats. The deck also includes countermagic in the form of Force of Will and Spell Pierce to protect its combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's strategy. It is a high-risk, high-reward deck that can win games quickly if its combo is not disrupted.
